reasoning: Ensures the software fails when there is not enough context or information to tag a word based on provided rules.
Tests what happens if the software does not recognize any part-of-speech for an uncommon phrase which falls under one of the categories like UH, EX, DT etc.
Checks the software's ability to acknowledge when it cannot make a determination and needs more information as per rule 4.
Tests boundary case where the software should fail to tag an unclear context based on provided constraints.
Assesses the situation when a word does not fit into any specified part-of-speech category but could be ambiguous or uncommon, e.g., exclamation mark usage within a UH tag scenario.
Ensures the software's recognition of edge cases where it lacks sufficient information to make a determination and must return CantAnswer.
